title: The dark history of IQ tests - Stefan C. Dombrowski

multiple-choice.question: Who designed the first IQ test in 1905?
What was the initial purpose of the IQ test designed by Binet and Simon?

options.label: A
options.text: To sort people into different racial groups

options.label: B
options.text: To identify children who required individualized attention

multiple-choice.question: During World War I, what was the military's use of IQ tests?

options.label: A
options.text: To evaluate the intelligence of enemy soldiers

options.label: B
options.text: To sort recruits and screen them for officer training

options.label: C
options.text: To determine the fitness of soldiers for combat

options.label: D
options.text: To identify soldiers with learning disabilities

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the military's use of IQ tests during World War I?

options.label: A
options.text: The creation of an accurate intelligence hierarchy of ethnic groups

options.label: B
options.text: The identification of a link between intelligence and a person's race

options.label: C
options.text: The creation of an erroneous intelligence hierarchy of ethnic groups

options.label: D
options.text: The rejection of the concept of IQ testing

multiple-choice.question: What is the Flynn Effect?

options.label: A
options.text: A phenomenon where new generations score consistently lower on old tests than each previous generation

options.label: B
options.text: A phenomenon where new generations score consistently higher on old tests than each previous generation

options.label: C
options.text: A phenomenon where the results of IQ tests are influenced by environmental factors

options.label: D
options.text: A phenomenon where the results of IQ tests are influenced by genetic factors

multiple-choice.question: What is the main concern about using IQ tests to diagnose psychiatric conditions?

options.label: A
options.text: That the test is not sensitive enough to detect underlying conditions

options.label: B
options.text: That the test is not specific enough to diagnose specific conditions

options.label: C
options.text: That the test relies on clinical judgment rather than objective results

options.label: D
options.text: That the test is not useful for making treatment decisions

multiple-choice.question: What is the current use of IQ tests?

options.label: B
options.text: To identify intellectual disability and determine appropriate educational support, job training, and assisted living

options.label: D
options.text: To evaluate the intelligence of enemy soldiers

multiple-choice.question: What is the main criticism of IQ testing?

options.label: A
options.text: That the test is not a good measure of intelligence

options.label: B
options.text: That the test is biased towards certain groups

options.label: C
options.text: That the test is not useful for making treatment decisions

options.label: D
options.text: That the test is not a good measure of reasoning and problem-solving skills

multiple-choice.question: What is the Flynn Effect likely caused by?

options.label: B
options.text: Environmental factors such as improved education, better healthcare, and better nutrition

multiple-choice.question: What is the main point of the passage about IQ testing?

options.label: A
options.text: That IQ testing is a good measure of intelligence

options.label: B
options.text: That IQ testing is a useful tool for making treatment decisions

options.label: C
options.text: That IQ testing has a complex and problematic history

options.label: D
options.text: That IQ testing is not useful for identifying intellectual disability

title: The 5 types of text structure

options.label: B
options.text: To give events in a specific order

options.label: C
options.text: To describe a topic and its characteristics

options.label: D
options.text: To compare and contrast two or more things

options.label: B
options.text: Next, then, before, first, second, and third

options.label: D
options.text: Both and, however, and in addition

multiple-choice.question: What is the main purpose of the Cause and Effect text structure?

options.label: A
options.text: To describe a topic and its characteristics

options.label: B
options.text: To give events in a specific order

options.label: C
options.text: To explain why something happened and what the consequences were

options.label: D
options.text: To compare and contrast two or more things

multiple-choice.question: What is the main purpose of the Problem and Solution text structure?

options.label: A
options.text: To describe a topic and its characteristics

options.label: B
options.text: To give events in a specific order

options.label: C
options.text: To explain why something happened and what the consequences were

options.label: D
options.text: To introduce a problem and then explain how it was solved

multiple-choice.question: What is the main purpose of the Compare and Contrast text structure?

options.label: A
options.text: To describe a topic and its characteristics

options.label: B
options.text: To give events in a specific order

options.label: C
options.text: To explain why something happened and what the consequences were

options.label: D
options.text: To explain how two or more things are similar and different

title: The Gauntlet | Think Like A Coder, Ep 8

multiple-choice.question: What is the main problem that Ethic and Hedge are trying to solve in the story?

options.label: A
options.text: They are trying to reach the Node of Memory in the heart of the city of Huxenborg.

options.label: B
options.text: They are trying to collect the three powerful artifacts.

options.label: C
options.text: They are trying to escape from the gauntlet of forking paths.

options.label: D
options.text: They are trying to understand the concept of recursion.

options.label: C
options.text: The power to communicate with any version of himself.

options.label: D
options.text: The power to see any version of himself.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: If you hear anything over the radio, you should radio to your parent whether you got to your spot by going left or right, then repeat everything you just heard.

options.label: A
options.text: A set of instructions given a label so that it can be easily reused.

options.label: B
options.text: A set of instructions that involves repetition and self-similarity.

options.label: C
options.text: A set of instructions that involves only one step.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: By using the Node of Memory.

options.label: C
options.text: By using the Gauntlet of Forking Paths.

options.label: D
options.text: By using the concept of recursion.

multiple-choice.question: What is the final outcome of the story?

options.label: A
options.text: Ethic and Hedge are able to collect the three powerful artifacts.

options.label: B
options.text: Ethic and Hedge are able to escape from the gauntlet of forking paths.

options.label: C
options.text: Ethic and Hedge are able to understand the concept of recursion.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of the Node of Creation in the story?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the source of the power that Hedge is granted.

options.label: B
